bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Bertha L. Lyons, April 26, 1948

div1.p: Hench discusses the upcoming Hall of Fame event.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Bertha L. Lyons, April 26, 1948
div1.opener:
April 26, 1948
Miss Bertha L. Lyons
Assistant to the Director
Hall of Fame, New York University
1 Madison Avenue
New York 10, New York
My dear Miss Lyons:
div1.p:
I have just heard from General Reed. He
prefers the courtesy line “By courtesy of Mrs. Walter
Reed”. I think that is excellent.

I am glad that you can use the photograph
of the Congressional Medal.

I shall be in New York May 8 and 9 attending
a committee meeting at the Waldorf-Astoria. I shall
return to be in New York at the Waldorf May 20, ar-
riving in the middle of the morning. I think the
train arrives at about 9:30 standard time; 10:30 New
York daylight time.

I am delighted to hear that General Truby
of San Francisco is coming on to the ceremony.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
